crates/fast-ta-experiments/src/data.rs.description: Synthetic data generators using ChaCha8Rng from rand_chacha for deterministic benchmarks. Key functions: generate_random_walk(n, seed), generate_ohlcv(n, seed), inject_nans(series, ratio, seed). OHLCV struct has validate_invariants() method for testing.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/traits.rs.description: SeriesElement trait extends num_traits::Float with additional methods for safe numeric conversions (from_usize, from_i32, from_f64). Blanket implementation covers all Float + NumCast + Copy + Default + Send + Sync types. ValidatedInput trait provides validation methods for slices and vectors.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/error.rs.description: Error enum with variants: InsufficientData(required, actual), NumericConversion(context), CyclicDependency(node_id), EmptyInput, InvalidPeriod(period, reason). Implements Display and std::error::Error. Result<T> type alias for Result<T, Error>.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/sma.r.description: SMA indicator implementation using O(n) rolling sum approach. Two functions provided: sma() which allocates a new output vector, and sma_into() which writes to a pre-allocated buffer. First (period-1) values are NaN. Comprehensive test suite with 30+ tests covering basic functionality, edge cases, error handling, and property-based tests.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/ema.r.description: EMA indicator implementation with two smoothing variants: standard EMA (alpha = 2/(period+1)) and Wilder's smoothing (alpha = 1/period). Functions provided: ema(), ema_into(), ema_wilder(), ema_wilder_into(), ema_with_alpha(), ema_with_alpha_into(). Also includes period conversion utilities: wilder_to_standard_period() and standard_to_wilder_period(). SMA is used as the seed value for the first EMA calculation.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/rsi.r.description: RSI indicator implementation using Wilder smoothing. Functions: rsi() and rsi_into(). First `period` values are NaN (need period+1 data points for first value). Boundary conditions: all gains → 100, all losses → 0, no movement → 50. Uses Wilder's smoothing formula: new_avg = (prev_avg * (period-1) + current) / period.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/macd..description: MACD indicator implementation using EMA components. Provides three outputs: MACD line (fast EMA - slow EMA), signal line (EMA of MACD line), and histogram (MACD - signal). MacdOutput struct bundles all three vectors. Functions: macd() and macd_into(). Standard parameters are 12, 26, 9. First slow_period-1 MACD values are NaN, first slow_period+signal_period-2 signal/histogram values are NaN.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/atr.r.description: ATR indicator implementation using Wilder smoothing. Provides true_range(), true_range_into(), atr(), atr_into() functions. True Range = max(High-Low, |High-PrevClose|, |Low-PrevClose|). Uses Wilder's smoothing formula: ATR = (prev_ATR * (period-1) + TR) / period. First `period` values are NaN. Properly handles overnight gaps by including gap distance in True Range calculation.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/bolli.description: Bollinger Bands indicator implementation using O(n) rolling sum and sum-of-squares approach. BollingerOutput struct bundles middle/upper/lower bands. Functions: bollinger(), bollinger_into(), rolling_stddev(), rolling_stddev_into(). Uses population variance (divide by n, not n-1). First period-1 values are NaN. Middle band equals SMA exactly.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/stoch.description: Stochastic Oscillator implementation with three variants: stochastic_fast(), stochastic_slow(), stochastic_full(). Uses rolling extrema to find highest high and lowest low. StochasticOutput struct bundles %K and %D lines. Fast variant: raw %K + SMA(%K). Slow variant: SMA(raw %K) + SMA(slow %K). Full variant: configurable smoothing periods. First k_period-1 values of %K are NaN. First k_period+d_period-2 values of %D are NaN.

crates/fast-ta-experiments/benches/e01_b.description: E01 baseline benchmark for all 7 indicators. Uses BenchmarkData struct to pre-generate price and OHLCV data before benchmarking. Benchmarks: bench_sma, bench_ema, bench_rsi, bench_macd, bench_atr, bench_bollinger, bench_stochastic, bench_all_indicators. Uses QUICK_DATA_SIZES (1K, 10K, 100K) for reasonable benchmark times. Imports common utilities via `mod common;` pattern.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/kernels/running_.description: RunningStat kernel using Welford's algorithm for numerically stable statistics. Provides RunningStat (online accumulator with update/remove for sliding windows), RollingStat (rolling window wrapper), and rolling_stats()/rolling_stats_into() functions. Computes mean, variance, and stddev in single pass. Tests verify fused == unfused by comparing against SMA and Bollinger's rolling_stddev implementations.

crates/fast-ta-experiments/benches/e02_r.description: E02 RunningStat fusion benchmarks comparing Welford's algorithm (fused single-pass) vs separate passes (SMA + rolling_stddev). Benchmarks include: fused_welford, separate_passes, bollinger_reference, component analysis (sma_only, stddev_only), period_comparison, throughput measurement, and preallocated buffer comparison. Success criteria: ≥20% speedup for fused approach.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/kernels/ema_fusi.description: EMA fusion kernel for computing multiple EMA-family indicators in single pass. Key functions: ema_multi() computes multiple EMAs with different periods together, ema_fusion() computes EMA/DEMA/TEMA simultaneously, macd_fusion() computes MACD with fused fast/slow EMAs. DEMA = 2×EMA - EMA(EMA), TEMA = 3×EMA - 3×EMA(EMA) + EMA(EMA(EMA)). All tests verify fused == unfused output via property tests.

crates/fast-ta-experiments/benches/e03_e.description: E03 EMA fusion benchmarks comparing fused vs independent EMA computations. Benchmarks include: fused_multi_ema (ema_multi), separate_emas (multiple ema calls), fused_ema_dema_tema (ema_fusion), separate_ema_dema_tema, fused_macd (macd_fusion), standard_macd, ema_count_scaling (3-20 EMAs), period_sensitivity, throughput, preallocated buffers, and single_ema baseline. Success criteria: ≥15% speedup for ≥10 EMAs.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/kernels/rolling_.description: Rolling Extrema kernel using monotonic deque for O(n) rolling max/min. Provides MonotonicDeque struct for tracking extrema, rolling_max(), rolling_min(), rolling_extrema() for computing both together, and naive O(n×k) versions for comparison. Tests verify fused == unfused output by comparing against naive scan approach.
